website_summaries.verdict: Not only is this a sturdy 6-inch bone, its delicious bacon and cheese-flavored filling will keep dogs entertained for ages.
pros: Naturally durable and long-lasting beef bone
Awesome for treating stress and anxiety
cons: Doesn’t use real cheese or bacon

customer_reviews.title: Very Dangerous 👎👎👎👎👎👎
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous for Dogs. Purchased for my Amstaff and Labrador Retriever. Both dogs seemed excited and went off to enjoy their new treat. Fortunately, I checked in a few minutes, whereas I immediately took bones and trashed. Reason: Both bones splintered like sharp toothpicks. Never Again. As you can see, these aren't cheap on a per bone basis.
customer_reviews.author: RCT

customer_reviews.title: This is a great choice for a dog who loves to chew
customer_reviews.text: This is a great choice for a dog who loves to chew. My dog annihilates traditional chew bones (eg, Dream Bones) in seconds and destroys all but the sturdiest, hard rubber toys. He likes his Kong toys for play, but he's an enthusiastic chewer so we needed something to satisfy that urge (besides socks, pillows. etc.!). I ordered this and he loves it. He immediately hunkered down and started working on it. We've had it for weeks now and he has hardly made a dent in the bone. He chews it every day. Very satisfied and will definitely re-order this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old non aggressive chewer pup did not have this 15 minutes and huge pieces broke off and the bone cracked making this bone very dangerous I had to throw it away. It was a waste of money I have purchased this brand before and had no issues I checked to make sure the bone was not too thin before I gave it to him. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sue1949

customer_reviews.title: Huge shard broke off within 2 minutes-dog almost choked
customer_reviews.text: My 30lb dog had the large size bone and broke a huge, long, sharp shard off of it in less than 2 minutes. Luckily I caught him as he was trying to swallow it or we would be in the dog ER right now. My dogs never eat bones unsupervised but even while watching them I will never buy these bones again, they’re too risky.
customer_reviews.author: EEP

customer_reviews.title: My Loves These...and No Mess
customer_reviews.text: I freeze them to make them last a little longer. And I sometimes fill the bones with peanut butter after she cleans out whatever flavor I buy. Again I freeze these as well. I buy about two cases of fifteen every year to year and a half. Because I freeze them one lasts at least three hours. Our dog is forty-five pounds. As I mentioned they don’t make a mess on whatever surface we’re on. I rated five stars on scent because we can’t smell anything when she’s working on one. We tried the smaller ones but she goes through those too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Typical Geek

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful!!!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve given our 70# Yellow Lab these before without much of an incident, however, this latest episode made me feel like I had to warn others. My dog has been able to get little chips off these bones before but nothing of this magnitude. Working the first 15 minutes, we heard a good “snap” come from her bone. When we looked down, a large, SHARP chip had come out and the bone had split a little way down from there. Had she ingested this chip, there’s no telling what it would have done to her insides. Upon looking at the bone further, it is split just down from the chip and now unusable. Be very careful if you use these!
customer_reviews.author: Rthomas61

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these.
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves these! They last a long time since it’s longer it’s hard for them to get to the center of the bone and keeps them interested. You can freeze it so it lasts longer, and when the center is gone you can refill the bone with different things such as peanut butter, banana, apples, treats, etc. and just freeze it and you have a brand new bone for your furry friend! I have an Aussie and a Corgi and they both are obsessed with these!
customer_reviews.author: Tilley K

customer_reviews.title: My golden loves these!
customer_reviews.text: This is my goldens 3rd bone and 1st with peanut butter filling, he loves them however i saw on the comments that agressive chewers need to be care ful. .my doggo is old and his back teeth are not good so i doubt he will go very far with this but it keeps him happy and occupied between meals. so hes an indoor doggo and poor thing gets bored. so this and his squeeky lambchop and hes happy.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeypony

customer_reviews.title: -1 star because he is easily able to eat into the white material/ bone that ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 4 stars because my dog loves it and cant really seem to separate himself from it. He's a champion breed pug, 25lbs and is ran 1 mile each day so he has strong shoulder and jaw muscles for a pug. -1 star because he is easily able to eat into the white material/ bone that houses the beef. I have not had this problem with the original type of bones I bought similar to this but a different manufacturer. This white stuff makes him puke while hes trying to get the beef. Again keep in mind he is a pug so they have sensitive stomachs to begin with. What is why I gave it 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Greyjack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a serious chewer.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 2 smaller dogs. They are serious chewers. Plus I think it helps to prevent plaque buildup. I generally let them gnaw on them once or twice a week. I put a very thin coating of peanut butter on the inside and place them in the freezer and they will chew for a couple of hours. They last a long time that way plus they don’t get bored with them. I throw them away when they get thin and sharp on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: sharonlee

customer_reviews.title: Great for powerful chewers!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with this bone or the larger one. I purchased tbis shorter one a month ago for my 4 month old English bull terrier and she loves it. Great for teething she had some stubborn k9 teeth that ddint want to come out and after chewing on this off and on for 2 weeks they came out. She has not got sick or chipped off any pieces. The larger bone I purchased was for a 8 month old Pit bull and it didnt make him sick and no small pieces chipped off. These bones will last a long time just keep refilling with a little peanut butter and cheese ir small treats. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great bone at a great price. Keeps Caledon busy for days!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES the cheese/bacon, so I ordered 3 but got the peanut butter ones instead. Checked my order and sure enough - the order was for cheese/bacon. Shame on Amazon for pulling the wrong order. My dog is NOT going to be happy! I am not going to bother the seller for a mistake I think Amazon made.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Rucinski

customer_reviews.title: Small variability but solid bone
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased two of these over a month span and they have small differences in the sizes but overall great! We have a 42lb black lab mix and he loves this bone! He likes the peanut butter and once the peanut butter is done he loves chewing and grinding his teeth on the bone. You can also refill the bone with your own peanut butter once it's empty. Be careful at first that your pup doesn't eat too much too fast or he may get sick.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: made my dog very sick
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy this product in all the flavor varieties delivered monthly through subscribe and save. However, the quality of this product has gone downhill. I noticed that the filling has started to smell rancid with flecks of mold in it. The bone itself started to break into shards and flake off when chewed whereas it had been very hard and sturdy before. My dog began having gastritis, intestinal distress with vomiting, large volumes of gas, and diarrhea. I took the bones away, and his problems cleared up in a few days. I can no longer recommend this brand. I cannot in good conscience risk my dogs life or health over a cheap treat.
customer_reviews.author: bezoarrn

customer_reviews.title: Dog's Favorite Treat!
customer_reviews.text: My German shepherd LOVES this bone! She's spent so many hours chewing and playing with it, so it's great when occupying her. She loved the peanut butter inside. We like this bone because it's refillable. After she ate the Red Barn peanut butter, we fill it with dog-friendly cheese, peanut butter, and other fun stuff so she's occupied. We're so glad we found this bone. :)
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Good bone for picky chewers.
customer_reviews.text: I get this for my border collie from time to time. She's definitely a picky eater when it comes to bones and treats, and this is by far her favorite one. I haven't personally had any problems with the smell as I have seen in some reviews, and it takes her a few hours to get the filling out of the center. Unlike other bones she will continue to chew on this one off and on until it finally wears down to the point I can't let her have it any longer. I highly recommend this bone!
customer_reviews.author: odie

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE -- COULD KILL YOUR DOG
customer_reviews.text: I just had to take my dog to the vet for a $1500 surgery after this bone. It splinters and splits, and the dog eats it and it cuts them up inside. ONLY FEED DOGS RAW BONES NOT THESE. Go to your local butcher shop / meat counter, ask for Marrow / Soup Bones -- Your dog will go crazy for them and it wont hurt them. WILL NEVER BUY AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: Sam R

customer_reviews.title: Keep 'Em Busy Bones!
customer_reviews.text: These filled bones are a must have in my home. I have two active dogs and for evenings when I can't get out to exercise them due to weather or other reasons, I pull out these filled bones. These filled bones keep the dogs busy for hours licking out the filling. Once the filling is gone, they still enjoy chewing on the bones. The bone itself lasts a very long time - even for my active chewers. Once the filling is gone, I'll sometimes spread some peanut butter on the inside. My dogs really enjoy being treated with these filled bones.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My lab LOVES these! Even after filling is gone. And that takes quite awhile. She will chew on the bone. Which is NOT LIKE rawhide. No sharp shredded pieces. If anything it’s like crumb off of bread. Tiny. Safe. Excellent purchase! I buy for all my friends new fur family members. They rave about them
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ann

customer_reviews.title: Lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: Our dog trainer recommended this and said hers last for about a year before she gets new ones just because "they get gross by that time". Our dog is loving it and it is lasting forever so far. It looks like if he ever gets all the peanut butter out we could easily fill it back up with more. It is very hard and is loud as hell when he drops it down the stairs. My dog loved it.
customer_reviews.author: newbie

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for us
customer_reviews.text: Our dog chewed through everything until we found these. It was the ONLY chew toy she didn't destroy in 5 - 30 minutes. She even ruined the basketball that we thought would be large enough. She's older now, but they are her favorite thing so we continue to get them - and on auto-delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My two large dogs loved these
customer_reviews.text: The bones I received were very good quality. They are heavy so probably not the best for small dogs. My large dogs were occupied with these bones for a while. They stopped showing interest when they could not reach any more of the filling inside. **TIP- once my dogs could not reach the filling, I re-filled them with dog friendly peanut butter or some wet dog food and froze them! They love it and it is nice to be able to keep re-using them.
customer_reviews.author: MCT

customer_reviews.title: Smaller each time
customer_reviews.text: We have had these bones on our subscribe and save for a while and they have just gotten smaller and smaller each month recently. It is disappointing because they used to keep our dogs busy for a WHILE licking all the peanut butter.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: These are good for the dog's teeth.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these bones, and chews it well after the peanut butter is gone. She becomes OCD with it. She won't put it down until she has the middle part cleaned out. These are good for their teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 bone!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these bones, however I was RIPPED OFF, having spent over $8 for ONE SMALL BONE. The pic had 3, and for the price I thought it would have that many. And upon receipt of the 1 little bone, I couldn't even send it back. I don't often feel ripped off, but this time I had to share so others knew what they were getting.
customer_reviews.author: Patio Diner :)

customer_reviews.title: For years the longest lasting dog treats ever
customer_reviews.text: Our two black labs 14 and 5 years old love these bones. They are so excited when they get these bones and spend the entire evening working on them. Even days later they chomp on them. They are the longest lasting dog treats by far. Even if they get bored with them a few days later they are chompin on them. Highly recommend. We have even "re-stuffed" them with peanut butter and granola then freeze them. The downside is when you kick one in the middle of the night...OUCH!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My best find ever
customer_reviews.text: These are great. After my dogs eat the filling out these bones last and last. I can put new fillings in like Peanut butter. I have a Pit and she is a brutal chewer. She has met her match with these bones!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Give that dog a bone.
customer_reviews.text: Our Frenchies love these. They have chewed these for months and none have broken or chipped off. No adverse reactions to the center treat paste which is great. We have bought these several times and will be getting a couple more in the next month or two to replace the older ones. The dogs will gnaw these things to a sharp edge and they do hurt when they use your foot as a stop so they can chew the other side. This is the reason for replacing them. So far, all US made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They last forever
customer_reviews.text: These are always a huge hit with the fur kids. Usually, they get one from Santa Paws every year, but I reupped when we got a new puppy. The other dogs never seem to do more than wear them down over a year and never get all of the goodies out of the middle so one a year LASTS! Our biggest dog is a 100 lb pit/bull mastiff mix.
customer_reviews.author: Mindi

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was 3 bones and a great deal but it's ONE
customer_reviews.text: IT'S ONLY ONE BONE. I thought it was 3 bones and a great deal but it's ONE. My dog loves all bones like this so just can't give a great revies.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by a friend so I decided to get some because I have powerful chewers that destroy everything. They love licking the peanut butter out of the center and then chewing on the bone. I bought these months ago and they still are holding strong. This has been the only thing that my dogs have not destroyed!
customer_reviews.author: jbird

customer_reviews.title: Impressive! Great for Power Chewers!
customer_reviews.text: LOL, I gave a 5 star for flavor but only because my dog loves it. I haven't tasted it. I have a American Staffy pit bull and to call him a power chewer is an understatement. He's been at this thing for about 3 weeks now and it's holding up. I'm impressed
customer_reviews.author: Christina Iacano

customer_reviews.title: My dogs go crazy for these!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs both love these bones. When all the filling is gone I restuff them with all kinds of things...canned dog food, chicken, veggies, etc. Then stick them in the freezer for a few hours and they love them all over again!!
customer_reviews.author: lexie

customer_reviews.title: Great product, my pup loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. This is the only treat/chew that lasts her more than a day! We have a few of these that have even lasted months which is unheard of for my mutt!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Dake

customer_reviews.title: Pieces break off, and ants love the filling too
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these bones, from our Chihuahuas to our Lab/Pit, however, our Lab has great teeth which can cause penetration, and these bones do splinter or leave chunks behind. So, if you have smaller dogs (or even your bigger dog), a chocking hazard or potential puncture wound could occur. I watch my dogs while they enjoy these so if I see any pieces break off, I throw them away. Also, ants love the filling, so they need to be stored if not being chewed on.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: These last months. I actually think our last one lasted over a year. We have GSDs and they highly enjoy them. The cost is great for how long they last. They don't splinter either which is a huge deal!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Peanut Butter Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, however, be prepared for peanut butter everywhere. And my poor dog's tongue could not reach all the way in (Shih Zhu), and there is no way to open it, or for even such a small dog to get his mouth around it. He became frustrated with the treat after a while. And what he could get to, usually wound up all over him, his mouth, the furniture, the floor, anywhere he was trying to eat it. But, despite all the problems, it kept him, entertained (although angrily entertained, but entertained none-the-less) until it looked so gross I had to toss it.
customer_reviews.author: NormalNobody

customer_reviews.title: Pup loved the fillings, but the bone splinters
customer_reviews.text: this was actually the 2nd one I purchased...my little guy, while teething, loved the first one....after he finished the filling, I stuffed other treats inside for him, and he continued to enjoy the bone. however, once he was finished teething, even at only 7.5 pounds, he was chipping off pieces of the bone - not a safe thing. I do not consider him to be a major chewer. you need to keep an eye on the bone, and check for splinters. perhaps other dogs are ok with this bone, but it's not for my little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie From BoontonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great bone!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves loves loves this bone! Worth every penny and lasts a long time with my voracious chewer. Getting the filling out takes a good while and then the flavor that remains promotes bone chewing long afterward. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DurhamMoose

customer_reviews.title: Hard & Heavy!!
customer_reviews.text: Hold crap! These are as hard & heavy as a dense rock. If you have marble or granite floors or even ceramic tile....I’d think twice about buying these. If it falls out of your dogs mouth or rolls off the couch, your floors are going to crack. Dog was not very interested in it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perricelli-gulli

customer_reviews.title: Best bone on market
customer_reviews.text: I have a very aggressive lab chewer. He loves these bones and they give him hours of pleasure. They do not splinter and the quality is unmatched. Little pricey, but well worth the added expense. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: thomas matthews

customer_reviews.title: Brittle!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two similar bones that I purchased at a pet store that have lasted forever. I gave these to my intense chewers and for some reason they seemed far more brittle than the ones at the pet store and were breaking apart as the dogs were trying to chew the center. I don't know if these particular ones were just older or what, but I'm going to go back to buying the ones at the pet store. Those I still have and they been refilled buy me 100 times. I had to take these ones away from my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha B

customer_reviews.title: dog would choke
customer_reviews.text: Bought many of these in past 6" long 3+ inches in diameter for large dogs ! The add say for large dogs! This thing is less than 1" I know my dog would choke on it ! This seller has a no return Policy ! so off to the trash can & too the pet store where I should have gone in the first place !
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: High quality chew toy for Fido
customer_reviews.text: Got this from my dog training class, and bought more here. The paste inside is basically impossible for a dog to get out, which means he keeps chewing and chewing, unaware that he'll never get it out. Dogs are stupid that way, which means this chew toy will keep Fido occupied for hours. I love it. In fact, my dog hides it under the couch pillows out of fear I'll steal it. This is REAL bone, I suspect from a cow femur. It's not plastic. This is the real deal and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. RobTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: brittle
customer_reviews.text: my dogs loved the insides and went over it like crazy. however - they figured out real fast that if they threw it to the ground the bone cracked/shattered and shards of bone went everywhere. my dogs got about three hours out of it before I tossed it in the trash. the shards were half and inch wide by 2-3 inches long. perfect to get stuck somewhere that only a vet could get it out.
customer_reviews.author: crazyalzado

customer_reviews.title: Great for the STRONGEST chewers!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 heavy chewers (German Wirehaired Pointers / Drahthaars) that destroy even the Kong toys. These bones last for a long time and I refill with a bit of no sodium peanut butter for a quick treat when they’re empty. I have them on auto delivery! *don’t leave outside... bugs will crawl inside. *my 4 prefer the peanut butter over other flavors
customer_reviews.author: German Wirehaired Pointer MOM of 4 dogs

customer_reviews.title: Months of fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these a few months ago. My 70-pound puppy was tearing the house apart and chewing everything he could get his paws on (I have a 20 year old Bose radio, and I had to buy so many replacement remotes that Bose cancelled my orders and accused me of being an unauthorized retailer!). My boy is still on the FIRST bone. I slip some cheese in the hole (or lightly spray with butter Pam and let dry) whenever he starts to get bored with it. Absolutely excellent product that has saved my sanity.
customer_reviews.author: XL

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these and they both came split up the middle! I did not see that both were broken and only returned one and the 2nd one broke apart when my dog started chewing it! It also splintered so I had to take it away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Do The Automatic Ordering
customer_reviews.text: I got the first couple and loved them. Then I accepted the automatic ordering. The second one that arrived was extremely small like 2x2x2. They are suppose to be 2 x 2 x 3
customer_reviews.author: ohioengineer

customer_reviews.title: A great way to keep your dog busy.
customer_reviews.text: the best thing ever for your dog. Not only does he stay busy with I tucking it it also helps clean his teeth. The bone rubs on his teeth. My husky is 12 years old and never had his teeth cleaned. This is a win win.
customer_reviews.author: rudy

customer_reviews.title: Super safe chewing for really big dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Have used these bones for many years for our Great Danes. Because they are sanitized but not "cooked" ... they remain hard and will not splinter. The dogs like the filling flavors. When they eat all the filling ... we put them in the dishwasher (to re-sanitize without cooking) and then re-fill them with special things (peanut butter, canned dog food, commercial products)
customer_reviews.author: real gypsy girl

customer_reviews.title: The puppy LOVES these!
customer_reviews.text: This chewy bone keeps her busy for a veeeeery long time. Trouble is that they are really too costly to give them to her as often as I'd like to. I have managed to find them locally for a better price point, but even at this cost they are a good value compared to the enjoyment my puppy gets out of them. And when I say they last for a good long time, I'm talking lasting her for a few days. No other chew I've found will last her as long and keep her attention until the bone is really chewed down to almost nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting treat for strong jaws!
customer_reviews.text: Our pitbull, whom we think must surely be part hyena, loves these bones more than anything in the whole world. More than the cat, more than her rope toy, and more than even food! She can spend hours happily gnawing and licking away at the peanut butter. Best of all: it actually lasts her for weeks! No toy, not even a kong, has withstood her mighty jaws for a week. :) (The only downside is the gross slurping noises she makes as she digs around for the peanut butter.)
customer_reviews.author: slashfemme

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Once the filling was gone my dog lost interest in this for a long time, but I didn’t want to throw it out hoping he would pick it up again. Which he did. He loves his bone now even with the filling gone
customer_reviews.author: SJM

customer_reviews.title: Dog bone chipped
customer_reviews.text: Very Dangerous!!!! Splinters quickly within hours my dog vomited. My dog loved it but the bone chipped right away. I've had others that didn't chip for years.
customer_reviews.author: Bostondw

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these! We bought them from here because they ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these! We bought them from here because they were cheaper than petsmart but they didn't last as long. I didn't have a problem with mold or anything like some commenters, but I wasn't impressed with their longevity. This is broken but the one we bought before this is still in tact (we have two dogs who like to steal and hide things so we always make sure we have at least 4 of every toy.)
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it! Great bone!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bone! We have a doggie door and our dog took the bone outside...when I went to look for it...the ants had attacked it...had to get rid of it but I was glad I had another to give it her!
customer_reviews.author: Gina S

customer_reviews.title: Very hard bone
customer_reviews.text: Bone material far too hard for dog to chew. Dog loves the filling but was unable to chew bone. This is a big young dog with strong teeth. I had to saw off ends to let dog finish bone. It actually dulled the saw blade. More like a ceramic bone than a chew bone.
customer_reviews.author: David Veness

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This bone is just as advertised. It's large, full of peanut butter and has lasted a very long time. The only negative is that when my dog chews it, little bone pieces get all over, so I don't let her chew it on the couch anymore, but still the best bone I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Tough, tasty, and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves the redbarn bones. The fillings are addictive and the bones are very difficult to get through. So far, she has only managed to cause minor damage to the bone itself. It doesn't break off in shards and is made in the USA, so I'm very happy with it. It also does not smell unlike many of her treats. Amazon offers some of the best pricing I've seen for redbarn products, they ship on time, and it all arrives in good condition even if it sometimes comes in a strangely large box.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Just seems like a waste
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this bone and was the first one I could actually get her to chew. Maybe I'm missing something but my puppy literally cannot get the stuffing out of the middle. And I have to really work at it to get some of it out for her. Just seems like a waste. And makes her breath smell just like cheese and bacon which is as horrible as it sounds. But at least she's not chewing furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: The best heavy duty bones for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: These bones are the absolute best! Actually everything I've purchased from Redbarn is excellent. I have 2 German Sheperds that can go thru a bone in a few minutes except for these. They spend hours and hours chewing on them. They have managed to get a good bit of the peanut butter out but the bones are still intact weeks later. Best money spend. Amazon selling them just sweetens the deal because they are way cheaper than regular pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Can never have too many!
customer_reviews.text: The actual bone last forever! Our dog loves these and they can be found all over the house! When the original inside stuff is gone we occasionally refill it with peanut butter or cheese whiz or cheese from a can or the Kong stuff in a can and freeze it and then bring it out if we leave the house. It's hours of entertainment for her! She gnaws on it regardless! Loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: M in Va

customer_reviews.title: My little guy--
customer_reviews.text: My little dog knew when the package came that something must be there for him. He tried to dig into the box, and was so excited. When I gave him this bone he knew what to do and he went to work on it. He had the center eaten within 30 min. I was amazed. He loved it. I will be ordering more but for right now I'm refilling it with healthy treats. The game goes on and on. I fill it and my little guy empties it. He and I recommend this seller and product 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Tippy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for boredom!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these and they last forever, even after the filling is gone she enjoys carrying the bone around.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brogan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 dogs didn’t seem to care to finish their bones. Plus, I kept finding pieces of the filling everywhere on the floor. It seemed to be dry and loose.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Nice chew bone
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old Lab is a horrific chewer. I bought this bone as an "add-on" item on an order I was placing with Amazon. It turned out to be a great match for my pup. He was truly entertained with it while trying to liberate the peanut butter from the bone ends. Then he tried to destroy the bone, but was unsuccessful. [Up to this point he has been able to devour every other bone I've given him.] Now I can just reload the bone ends with more peanut butter and he's off to the races again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tessmer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: My dog demolished it within 5 mins. Had to take it away from her I thought she was going to choke on the pieces. Maybe 3" long. Could have gone to the grocery store and picked up a bigger one for the same price
customer_reviews.author: Cat Baker

customer_reviews.title: HAZARDOUS for small to medium dogs
customer_reviews.text: My medium size Basenji mix dog got her paw stuck in the bone and got seriously injured. She was in pain for a while. I would not recommend this for smaller dogs whose paw fits in the opening on either end.
customer_reviews.author: RaVen

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these bones!
customer_reviews.text: My friend told me about these bones and I save them for special occasions. It keeps my dog occupied for hours. First he looks all over the house to find a place to hide it...then he worries over it like the commercial dog....then he licks on it for hours. The bone is very heavy...sometimes a put a little real peanutbutter in the middle for a treat in the empty bone, when he finishes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ready to travel

customer_reviews.title: Old Dried Out Product
customer_reviews.text: The two Red Barn peanut butter stuffed bones I ordered arrived dried out, mealy and hard. I’ve purchased these bones for several years for my pups and never seen them look like this before. Usually the stuffing is much softer, almost like a firm jelly texture. My dogs, who are usually crazy over them wouldn’t even touch them.
customer_reviews.author: MDK

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dog
customer_reviews.text: This is my dogs favorite! I got it for her as a birthday present but when she finally gets through it I will definitely buy another one. The filling is like a hard gel so you do not need to worry about peanut butter getting everywhere. The bone will take a long time to get through but the filling keeps to dog interested. Everyday I come home from work and I find the bone in a different location so I know it has been keeping her busy while I am work and it keeps her from getting into the trash and other places she should not be.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love this -
customer_reviews.text: The Red Barn filled bones are the best treat we have found for our corgis ( who love to chew everything.) This keeps them busy for a long time - Plus it help clean their teeth and is long lasting. When the filling is gone - we refill with peanut butter and freeze. They eventually wear down - and then we order more. But we have found this is the best treat we can give them. We totally stopped buying rawhide after one of our dogs had bloat -- now the Red Barn filled real bones are the only treats we allow for our two dogs.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this bone a few times but this time, it arrived broken. It was unusable and now, after seeing similar reviews, I don’t trust this brand not to break off during use or arrive broken.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Bone
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a real bone filled with peanut butter, Which our German Shepherd dog Loves anything to chew on, First mistake was to have him as a house dog with not enough toys, he got bored one night and ate the leather off my 2500.00 Chaise lounge chair. Ever since I have bought may toys for him of all kinds to keep him busy with out the leather incident occurring again. He loves this bone but I have concerns on safety is the only reason I gave this 4 stars. Concerned it might splinter off and tear his stomach and or intestines.
customer_reviews.author: Macattack

customer_reviews.title: Redbarn PB Knuckles are so much better
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the Redbarn PB Filled Knuckle Bone was out of stock and I got these as a treat instead. Our large german sheperds love them but they dont keep them chewing for long and then you end up with a whole bone with a little PB in the middle and then they are done. I leave them in their toy basket but they dont ever get them back out.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Product Description vs Actual Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Great bone, not-so-great filling for our dog. It would have been helpful to know the ingredients before purchasing. Ingredients: Beef Bone, Filling: Corn Syrup, Water, Chicken Meal, Sugar, Beef Fat, Salt, Vegetable Glycerin, Agar, Citric Acid, Potassium Sorbate, Lecithin, Natural Lamb Flavor, Sodium Benzoate, Yellow 5, Yellow 6, Red 40. Our dog is allergic to chicken and had a reaction soon after eating the filling. We were also disappointed to learn that corn syrup, water and sugar were ingredients 1,2 & 4. We previously bought Redbarn Lamb and Rice Food Roll and were very pleased with everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Not a pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: Dogs loves it... so I love it
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves this bone. He got most of the filling out by himself and what he couldn't reach, I picked out for him since it was getting mega gross. He still plays with the bone, too. It's a sturdy bone, which I am most happy about. He cannot break it and has only managed to deal a small amount of damage to it. Also, you can fill the bone with peanut butter, except not me because my dog hates peanut butter. At less than $10 I think it's a great value for destructo doggies like my 1 year old Lab mix.
customer_reviews.author: byatlswing

customer_reviews.title: Doggie Heaven
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these bones, the only think I don't like about them is how loud it is when my Mastiff is chewing on hers. The bone lasts my girl a long time, she can chew on the same one for 6 months or longer.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Bach

customer_reviews.title: Too durable
customer_reviews.text: My dog was only interested in this for a few days. He usually chews through bones completely. It is durable and will last awhile if it can hold your dog's interest.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Please beware— dangerous bones
customer_reviews.text: These bones are dangerous. After chewing up this bone my dog had severe stomach pain and constipation, resulting in pooping in her crate (which she has never done) and the worst part is that her stool had shards of large sharp bone in it. I can’t imagine how painful it had been. I hope we don’t need medical intervention. 😕
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: Massive beast dog loves these.
customer_reviews.text: The beast loves these. If they only made a version that didn't require you to listen to the disgusting slurping noise my dog makes when getting the yummy stuff from the center.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. After a while though she will bite the ends and they will break off in sharp pieces so always supervise.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to enjoy this. I needed to find a bone that would last longer than an hour. This bone has. To long infact. He chews on it daily and I bought this about 4 months ago. Though, he did manage to get all the peanut butter out within a week. My dog is a Walker Hound about 70 pounds and I'm glad I was able to find something for him to chew on that would last. I haven't noticed any issues like some reviewers have, but you have risk with all toys/bones that you give your pets.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Too big for a beagle
customer_reviews.text: My dog just licked the peanut butter out and didn't chew the bone. I think that the bone was too big for his mouth or didn't have any flavor of it's own to make him want to chew it. Maybe this is for larger dogs only? I should have just put peanut butter inside his old bone. Same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kaberg72

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs (lab & German shepherd) LOVE them! They keep them occupied for quite awhile
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these in the past from our local petstore, but realized I could purchase them on Amazon for 1/2 the price. Our dogs (lab & German shepherd) LOVE them! They keep them occupied for quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Fractured Tooth
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get one of these for my lab based on the reviews and recommendations from friends. Everything seemed great at first, my dog loved it and this seems to hold up much better than other chew toys. But I think that is that problem, these are possibly too hard. Soon after giving the Redbarn to my dog, he fractured one of his back teeth. This resulted in an expensive tooth extraction surgery for my buddy.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 2, both arrived w/mold on one end
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this type of bone, different brands, for my dogs before and they both love them, but previously when I've purchased it's always been in store. This time I ordered them from Amazon and when they arrived today, both bones were moldy on one end. I was pretty disbelieving so I handed them off to my husband who only had to glance at them. I had them packaged for return shipping within five minutes of receiving the package. It's pretty gross that Amazon packaged these and shipped them to me, since just a glance shows the mold on the end of each one. Really disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Angela James

customer_reviews.title: Great for a chewer dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog will chew up everything bones and toys never last long. I was surprised to see that the bone kept him busy for two days straight! Also it smelt so good in the inside ideas tempted to take a Bite! Great buy great price will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy chewers
customer_reviews.text: Love these heavy duty bones for our Vizsla. They last for a long time; when she's cleaned out the filling we re-stuff with puparoni and she stays occupied for hours. Eventually she wears through the bone on the ends and we replace them; we average about three months of use per bone. This is the best price I've found on them; great value. We've gone through about 6 so far, I've never seen them splinter or crack despite heavy chewing. Our pup will even just lick/chew on them when they aren't full of treats.
customer_reviews.author: doorkeepr

customer_reviews.title: Frenchie Approved
customer_reviews.text: My Frenchie absolutely loves this bone! She is very particular on what bones she chews or toys she plays with and this one is a hit. She loves deer antlers and they at times only last a few short days. I always supervise her when she is playing with this one. I will definitely be refilling and buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: Our Golden likes the inside but if this dropped on a foot, I have no doubt it would break a bone - it is that heavy. He enjoys chewing it ok, but really likes the inside however once it's to the middle, he can't get it out anymore.
customer_reviews.author: lc's mommy

customer_reviews.title: Pups Can't Get Enough!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old rat terrier mix and 3 year old bichon love filled toys and bones. I saw this and decided to give it a try. The shipping was prompt and was exactly as it described. If the bone is cold from the weather when you get it, I suggest letting it warm up a bit since a lot of dogs can push the filling out if it's stiff. My dogs went crazy over it! You couldn't distract them from it for a second. I recommend this for any dogs that love to chew on bones or that love toys that can be filled.
customer_reviews.author: Renee N. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Give your dog a GOOD bone
customer_reviews.text: Has a dog ever refused a bone?? And the filling in these makes them go crazy--they chew for hours. The only problem is that when the tongue no longer reaches the filling, the interest diminishes. Then the filling gets hard inside and I guess the smell goes away. It might be good to get shorter bones so the filling can be reached from both ends
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Never shipped
customer_reviews.text: The seller charged me but never shipped this product. I have used these for years and the product is generally good and I would rate them 4 stars. If they were more durable I would rate them a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Karl N. Nieberlein

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: It was a good bone but when you try and fill it with PB or kong PB it ended up molding cuz my dog could not reach all of the stuffing & it molded. I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly C.

customer_reviews.title: Everlasting dog bone!
customer_reviews.text: Ok this may be the best bone I have ever bought for my dog! I seriously bought this like 6 months ago and no matter how much she chews on it, it is so hard that she barely scratches it! The filling inside is mostly gone but she still loves to chew on it. We even supplement the filling on the inside by putting small amounts of peanut butter in it and she loves that even more! If you have a dog that likes to chew on stuff I highly recommend this! It seriously is the everlasting gobstopper bone for dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Durable but extremely heavy and hard
customer_reviews.text: This bone might be good for a serious power chewer, but it’s too hard to be any fun for my 8 year old Golden. Once he got as much peanut butter off the ends as he could he was no longer interested.
customer_reviews.author: Winter

customer_reviews.title: Great for power chewers!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these! Great for the power chewer! I have a pit mix and she loves these bones! They are durable and hold up to the strongest chewing, but like other bones, always keep an eye out because from the constant chewing pieces of bone can break off.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu1020

customer_reviews.title: Both our grandpups did not like the jelly
customer_reviews.text: We had to scrape out the jelly and fill that in with jerky so they would chew on the bone.so disappointed 🙁
customer_reviews.author: Christina

product_meta.title: Redbarn 3 to 6" Filled Dog Bones (Peanut Butter, Cheese N' Bacon, Beef), Natural Long-Lasting Dental Treats; Suitable for Aggressive Chewers.
feature_bullets: Natural beef femur bone with highly palatable fillings. No grains or rawhide!
Satisfies their natural instinct to chew for the perfect pairing of health and taste. These natural dog dental bone chews help to remove harmful plaque and tartar supporting overall dental health.

Our Filled Bone manufacturing process is a unique blend of state-of-the-art technology and handcrafted quality. First, the all-natural beef femur bones are bathed in industrial steel vats, allowing the bones to naturally clean themselves. Then, they’re oven-roasted for maximum safety. Finally, we hand-fill every bone through a proprietary process, allowing our original Filled Bones to stay semi-moist and perfectly placed, adhering to bone walls instead of carpets.
Chewing is a natural boredom-buster, stress-reliever, and plaque-remover for your dog. This durable, long-lasting treat will keep your power chewer busy!

Safety is our top priority. Our in-house quality assurance team performs more than 2,500 tests per month. Our white bones are natural beef femur bones sourced from grass-fed cattle. Cleaned and cooked in our company-owned Kansas facility, each bone is naturally cleaned without the use of bleach or harsh chemicals and baked in ovens for increased safety and durability.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
